title: Stuck Contactor (Welded Contacts)
description: The customer complains that the outdoor unit runs continuously, even when the thermostat is turned off. The compressor and fan never shut down.
symptoms: Compressor and condenser fan won't turn off

faults.description: Contactor contacts are welded closed - unit runs regardless of control signal

diagnosticSteps.description: Turn off thermostat and observe unit
diagnosticSteps.action: Set thermostat to OFF and check if outdoor unit stops
diagnosticSteps.expectedResult: Unit should stop; if it continues running, there's a problem
diagnosticSteps.hint: A continuously running unit despite thermostat off is a key symptom

diagnosticSteps.action: Measure voltage at contactor coil with thermostat OFF
diagnosticSteps.expectedResult: Should read 0V when thermostat is not calling
diagnosticSteps.hint: 0V at coil but unit still running indicates stuck contacts

diagnosticSteps.action: With power OFF, physically inspect the contactor contacts
diagnosticSteps.expectedResult: Contacts should move freely when pushed
diagnosticSteps.hint: Welded contacts will be stuck together

diagnosticSteps.action: With power OFF and coil de-energized, check continuity through contacts
diagnosticSteps.expectedResult: Should be OPEN (OL) when contactor is not energized
diagnosticSteps.hint: If contacts show continuity when coil is off, they're welded

learningObjectives: Recognize symptoms of a stuck/welded contactor
Understand the danger of a continuously running compressor
Differentiate between control circuit and power circuit issues
